panels.description:
HTTP Responses per second.
IMPORTANT: Panel will reflect instance variable value(s).
panels.title: Responses - (Rate)

panels.description:
Login requests per second.
IMPORTANT: Panel will reflect instance variable value(s).
panels.title: Requests - Login (Rate)

panels.description: Time required to complete a login request.
panels.title: Requests - Login (Duration)

panels.description:
Non-Login requests per second.
IMPORTANT: Panel will reflect instance variable value(s).
panels.title: Requests - Non-Login (Rate)

panels.description: Time required to complete a non-login request.
panels.title: Requests - Non-Login (Duration)

panels.description: Requests per second rejected due to exceeding the lease count quota
panels.title: Quotas - Lease Violations (Rate)

panels.description: Requests per second rejected due to exceeding the rate limit quota rule.
panels.title: Quota - Rate Limit Violations (Rate)

panels.description: Number of requests currently in progress.
panels.title: Requests - In-Flight

panels.description: Number of un-expired and un-revoked service tokens (across all namespaces) available for use in the token store.
panels.title: ^* Tokens

panels.description: Number of leases (across all namespaces).
panels.title: ^ Leases - Expiration Eligible

panels.description: Number of identity entities (across all namespaces) currently stored in Vault.
panels.title: ^ Entities

panels.description: The number of distinct clients across all namespaces seen from the start of the current billing period to the current moment.
panels.title: ^* Clients

panels.description: Number of leases (across all namespaces) that have been marked irrevocable.
panels.title: ^ Leases - Expiration Irrevocable

panels.description: Total memory obtained from the OS.
panels.title: Allocated Memory

panels.description: Utilization of the memory allocated to Vault.

targets.expr:
vault_runtime_alloc_bytes{job=~"$job",cluster=~"$cluster",instance=~"$instance"} # represents heap allocations only 
/
vault_runtime_sys_bytes{job=~"$job",cluster=~"$cluster",instance=~"$instance"} # total memory obtained from the OS, including heap, stacks, and internal data structures
* 100

panels.title: Allocated Memory (Utilization)

panels.description: The number of allocated heap objects in memory.
panels.title: Allocated Heap Objects

panels.description: Total number of Go routines running in memory.
panels.title: Goroutines

panels.description:
How frequently garbage collection process runs.
IMPORTANT: Panel will reflect instance variable value(s).
panels.title: Garbage Collection (Rate)

panels.description: Time required to complete garbage collection run
panels.title: Garbage Collection (Duration)

panels.description: Cluster active node.
panels.title: Leadership

panels.description: Indicates whether a Vault node is healthy from the perspective of the active node.
panels.title: ^ Autopilot Node Health

panels.description: Time required to commit a new entry to the raft log on the leader node.
panels.title: ^ Raft Commit Time (Duration)

panels.description: Time since the leader was last able to contact the follower nodes when checking its leader lease.
panels.title: ^ Raft Contact Followers (Duration)

panels.description: The time required to flush a write-ahead log that is ready for storage to the persist queue.
panels.title: ^ WAL Flush (Duration)

panels.description: The time required to persist a write-ahead log to the storage backend.
panels.title: ^ WAL Persist Storage (Duration)

panels.description: Time taken to send an echo request from a [performance] standby to the active node.
panels.title: Standby - RPC Client Echo (Duration)

panels.description: [Performance] Standby echo request failures per second.
panels.title: Standby - RPC Echo (Errors)

panels.description: Time taken to forward a request from a [performance] standby to the active node.
panels.title: Standby - RPC Client Forward (Duration)

panels.description: Standby request forwarding failures per second.
panels.title: Standby - RPC Client Forward (Errors)

panels.description:
Successful audit device writes per second.
IMPORTANT: Panel will reflect instance variable value(s).
panels.title: Audit Log Sink (Rate)

panels.description:
Errors per second encountered while writing to an audit device.
A blank panel indicates no errors emitted within specified range.
panels.title: Audit Log Sink (Errors)

panels.description: Current role in a disaster recovery replication set. If enabled, primary or secondary is displayed.
panels.title: ^ Role - Disaster Replication

panels.description: Index of the last write-ahead log known to the primary that shipped to the DR secondary.

targets.expr:
# if active node is dr primary role, then last_dr_wal
  ( 
    vault_replication_wal_last_dr_wal{job=~"$job",cluster=~"$cluster"} and on(instance) (vault_core_active == 1)
  )
and
  on() (vault_core_replication_dr_primary{job=~"$job",cluster=~"$cluster"} and on(instance) (vault_core_active == 1)) > 0

panels.title: ^ Last WAL - DR Primary

panels.description: Current role in a performance replication set. If enabled, primary or secondary is displayed.
panels.title: ^ Role - Performance Replication

panels.description: Index of the last write-ahead log known to the primary that shipped to the performance secondary.

targets.expr:
# if active node is perf primary role, then last_perf_wal
    (
        vault_replication_wal_last_performance_wal{job=~"$job",cluster=~"$cluster"} and on(instance) (vault_core_active == 1)
    )
and
    on() (vault_core_replication_performance_primary{job=~"$job",cluster=~"$cluster"} and on(instance) (vault_core_active == 1)) > 0

panels.title: ^ Last WAL - Performance Primary

panels.description: Index of the last write-ahead log received from the upstream cluster.

targets.expr:
# if active node is a secondary role, then last_remove_wal
  (
      vault_replication_fsm_last_remote_wal{job=~"$job",cluster=~"$cluster"}
    and on(instance)
      (vault_core_active == 1)
  )
and on()
  (
      (vault_core_replication_dr_secondary{job=~"$job",cluster=~"$cluster"} and on(instance) (vault_core_active == 1))
    >
      0 
  or 
      (vault_core_replication_performance_secondary{job=~"$job",cluster=~"$cluster"} and on(instance) (vault_core_active == 1))
    >
      0
  )

panels.title: ^ Last Remote WAL - Secondary

panels.description: Merkle tree delta comparisons performed per second among the clusters participating in replication.
panels.title: ^ Merkle Tree - Diff (Rate)

panels.description: Time required to perform a Merkle tree delta comparison among the clusters participating in replication.
panels.title: ^ Merkle Tree - Diff (Duration)

panels.description: Merkle tree synchronizations performed per second with the most recent delta generated by the clusters participating in replication.
panels.title: ^ Merkle Tree - Sync (Rate)

panels.description: Time required to perform a Merkle tree synchronization with the most recent delta generated by the clusters participating in replication.
panels.title: ^ Merkle Tree - Sync (Duration)

panels.description: Successful snapshots over range
panels.title: ^ Inventory

panels.description: Errors per second encountered while trying to save a snapshot.
panels.title: ^ Save Operation (Errors)

panels.description: The time required to save the snapshot by config.
panels.title: ^ Save Operation (Duration)

panels.description: The time required to rotate out the snapshot indicated by config's retention period.
panels.title: ^ Rotation Operation (Duration)

panels.description: Indicates whether each Vault instance is currently unsealed.
panels.title: Seal - Status

panels.description: The number of days until the Vault Enterprise license will expire.
panels.title: License - Expiration

panels.description: Time required to complete post-unseal operations.
panels.title: Seal - Post-Unseal (Duration)

panels.description: Time required to complete unseal operations.
panels.title: Seal - Unseal (Duration)

panels.description:
The total size (cluster scope) of the relevant mount table type.

NOTE: Maximum (1MiB) and thresholds defined for integrated storage.
panels.title: ^ Mounts - Size

panels.description:
The total number (cluster scope) of the relevant mount table type.

NOTE: Maximum (~14000) and thresholds defined for integrated storage.
panels.title: ^ Mounts - Count

panels.description: Time required to fetch ACL and token entries.
panels.title: Policy and Token Retrieval (Duration)

panels.description: The total number of identity entities currently stored in Vault.
panels.title: ^ Entities - Count
